page.title: 11 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The existence of Gt.Staughton is recorded in the Domesday Book of 1086. The reference is to the Manor and "...land for sixteen ploughs". The origin of the name{Gt.Staughton (Gt.Storton) is probably 'Stockton'- a stockaded township- which was the part of the Village we now call the 'Town'. Gt.Staughton has several fine examples of 16th. & 17th. Century architecture....as in 'Little Thatch' and 'The Chestnuts' (houses on The Highway); the Barn at 'Place House'; 'Taggart Gallery' and 'White Hart' Public House (old Staging Inns).It is, perhaps, symbolic of our fascination for the past that a new development - Lion Court - is based on the design of the 'White Hart'. Along The Highway is a brick-based Sundial dating from 1637 which was possibly once the old Village Cross.
